intro: Physaria densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that are inflated and contain several seeds, which are dispersed when the pods dry and burst. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments with limited water availability. Physaria densiflora is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along roadsides.
